'''Fletchinder''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ヒノヤコマ''' ''Hinoyakoma'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Fletchling}} starting at [[level]] 17 and evolves into {{p|Talonflame}} starting at level 35.

==Biology==
Fletchinder is an avian Pokémon with predominantly orange and black plumage. It has a sharp, black beak and a small, pointed crest atop its head. Its black eyes have yellow, mask-like marks extending from the back. It upperside is reddish-orange and its belly is gray, with a flame pattern marking the boundary on the breast. Its pointed wings are black with yellow tips and undersides. Its legs are also black, with sharp talons with two toes forward and one back. Its long black tailfeathers are marked with two white "v"-shapes. The tail ends in two points and has another feather sticking out of the base on each side, giving the impression of the fletching on the end of an arrow.

Fletchinder has a flame sac in its belly. As its internal fire gradually heats up, it can fly at increasingly faster speeds. Fletchinder is known to hunt by igniting tall grass and swooping down on prey that attempt to escape the blaze. It is territorial, even against its own kind.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Fletchinder.png|thumb|left|250px|Fletchinder in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]

===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Fletchinder]]====
Ash's {{p|Fletchling}} [[Evolution|evolved]] into a {{AP|Fletchinder}} in ''[[XY036|Battles in the Sky!]]''. It later evolved into a {{AP|Talonflame}} in ''[[XY086|A Legendary Photo Op!]]''.

====Other====
Fletchinder debuted in ''[[XY020|Breaking Titles at the Chateau!]]'' at the [[Battle Chateau]], under the ownership of a Trainer named [[Nico]]. Nico used Fletchinder in a battle against [[Farrell]]'s {{p|Dusknoir}} and defeated it after a hard battle.

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Fletchinder appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A wild Fletchinder appeared during a flashback in ''[[SS036|The Legend of X, Y, and Z!]]''.

A Trainer's Fletchinder appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]''.

==Trivia==
<!--Fletchinder does NOT have the longest name. Crabominable has the longest name and its trivia already says so.-->
* Fletchinder is the [[List of Pokémon with unique base stat totals|only Pokémon]] with a base stat total of 382.
* Fletchinder shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Simisear}}. They are both known as the Ember Pokémon.
* Fletchinder was designed by [[Saya Tsuruta]].

===Origin===
Fletchinder is based on a {{wp|Japanese robin}}. Its {{t|Fire}} type may be a reference to the {{wp|flame robin}}.
====Name origin====
Fletchinder may be a combination of ''{{wp|fletching}}'' and ''tinder,'' or possibly ''cinder''.

Hinoyakoma may be a combination of 火の粉 ''hinoko'' (sparks), 矢 ''ya'' (arrow), and 駒鳥 ''komadori'' ({{wp|Japanese Robin}}).
